page.title: 15Heworth,Old Village Site
page.content: Heworth,at present a single farm,about a mile north east of Aycliffe,is an ancient site,divided from the village by the main London-Edinburgh railway and the River Skerne running North and South.In 1183 Heworth was held by Gilbertus for 3 marks;by 1380 it was owned by William de Bruys by foreign service and 15s.rent. Robert de Bruys sold Heworth to William Hoton in 1435 who in 1441 passed it to the trustees of the See of Durham. On the attainder of Anthony Hebborne for high treason in 1572 Queen Elizabeth I granted possession to Sir William Drurie and Ralph Scudamore.The land then passed through the families of Salvin, Byerley,Millbank, Watson and Swire to Lord Eden.Heworth is now farmed by a well known Durham farming family,the Herberts.
